framework: Enhanced DSV (Deconstruct, Synthesize, and Verify) with Dynamic Examples
input_sentence: At intersections and junctions ego must yield to the other vehicles coming from right side of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego is at an intersection or junction
Other vehicles are coming from the right side of ego

temporal_relations.description: When ego is at intersection/junction and vehicles come from right, ego must yield

lexicon.at_intersection_junction: Ego is at an intersection or junction
lexicon.vehicles_from_right: Other vehicles are coming from the right side of ego

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
The semantic specification sketch describes a traffic scenario with three atomic propositions: "at_intersection_junction" (ego is at intersection/junction), "vehicles_from_right" (other vehicles coming from right), and "ego_yields" (ego yields to vehicles). The temporal relation specifies an implication where the conjunction of "at_intersection_junction" and "vehicles_from_right" implies "ego_yields". The global property is specified as "Always", indicating this implication should hold globally. Since no metric time constraints are provided in the metric_constraints array, this is a pure temporal logic property without specific time bounds. The natural language description "When ego is at intersection/junction and vehicles come from right, ego must yield" maps to a global implication in MTL. Using the operator mapping, "Always" corresponds to the G operator, and the implication structure maps directly to the logical implication connective.

Final MTL Formula:
G((at_intersection_junction & vehicles_from_right) -> ego_yields)

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning: The semantic specification sketch describes a traffic scenario with three atomic propositions: "at_intersection_junction" (ego is at intersection/junction), "vehicles_from_right" (other vehicles coming from right), and "ego_yields" (ego yields to vehicles). The temporal relation specifies an implication where the conjunction of "at_intersection_junction" and "vehicles_from_right" implies "ego_yields". The global property is specified as "Always", indicating this implication should hold globally. Since no metric time constraints are provided in the metric_constraints array, this is a pure temporal logic property without specific time bounds. The natural language description "When ego is at intersection/junction and vehicles come from right, ego must yield" maps to a global implication in MTL. Using the operator mapping, "Always" corresponds to the G operator, and the implication structure maps directly to the logical implication connective.

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
The MTL formula G((at_intersection_junction ∧ vehicles_from_right) → ego_yields) consists of several components:

1. **G** operator: This is the global/always operator, meaning the entire condition must hold at all times.

2. **Implication structure**: The formula has the form G(condition → action), which translates to "always, if condition holds then action must occur."

3. **Condition part**: (at_intersection_junction ∧ vehicles_from_right)
   - ∧ represents logical AND
   - at_intersection_junction: ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction
   - vehicles_from_right: other vehicles are approaching from the right side

4. **Action part**: ego_yields
   - ego_yields: ego vehicle yields to other vehicles

5. **Temporal aspect**: Since this uses the G operator without specific time bounds, this represents a continuous requirement that applies at all times.

The formula does not contain any bounded temporal operators (F_[a,b], G_[a,b], etc.), so the translation focuses on the logical relationship and the global requirement.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction and other vehicles are approaching from the right side, then the ego vehicle must yield to those vehicles.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction and other vehicles are approaching from the right side, then the ego vehicle must yield to those vehicles.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
